page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This block is part of the West Yorkshire Conurbation.Birkenshaw, Drighlington,Brownhill,Birstall,and Gomersal form the perimeter.Six A-roads criss-cross the area whilst the M62 slashes what open countryside there is in an E-W direction. As foothills of the Pennine Range the land is undulating,naturally moorland, but reclaimed in several areas for agriculture-mainly market-gardening or stock-fattening.Disused pits and railways are a feature of the area. The original settlements are mainly local stone;they owe their origins to production,housing and services in the Woollen Industry.With the latters demise,many of the mills have been demolished or converted to light industry.Conversely,stone housing is being modernised and brick houses added to form dormitory settlements.
